title: Chvrches.Coachella.Festival.2014.H264.AC3.720p
description:
Having already uploaded a torrent of these performances at 1080p, I decided to bring them down to a more manageable 720p for weaker machines, and (for me at least) with no perceptible loss in visual quality. In actual fact, there's a small gain in quality for me because my machine lacks the video RAM to render a 1080p stream properly.

Naturally I wouldn't have expected any loss since my monitor is only 1366x768 meaning that 1080p is of no "theoretical" advantage to me. Or, it *wouldn't be* unless the conversion to 720p was done so poorly, say by some hack civil servant working over at BBC headquarters that you can't fire because it's a government job, and who, without fail, every week manages to severely mutilate yet another otherwise perfect Jools Holland program. 

That is why I never visit the BBS's YouTube channel; It's just too depressing, especially now since nobody else is allowed to upload that same content.

But, that's not the case here. I do know a little bit about what I'm doing.

Here is the track list again (complete show had 11 tracks):
----------------------------------------------------------
1. We Sink
2. Recover
3. Tether
4. Under The Tide
5. The Mother We Share

Here is an example of the video quality numerically (visually is another matter):
